definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: For the test subset, we withheld the scores.
sentences.chinese: 在测试子集中，我们保留了打分。

sentences.english: Investors should then rank, on the same scale, their overall impression of the manager from the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 投资者然后应该按照同样的标准给会面后的印象打分。

sentences.english: Department heads review the reviews, re-grade and re-rank.
sentences.chinese: 部门负责人会审查评估结果，重新打分和排名。

sentences.english: Papers are sent to UCLES for marking.
sentences.chinese: 试卷被送往剑桥大学考试委员会打分。

sentences.english: After the debate the subjects were asked to rate the candidates' performances.
sentences.chinese: 辩论结束后，学生们给两位竞选人的表现打分。

sentences.english: At each subset, user rating data is grouped by user. First line for a user is formatted as
sentences.chinese: 在每个子集中，永固打分数据按照用户分组。

sentences.english: The teacher is marking the examination papers.
sentences.chinese: 教师正在给试卷打分数。

sentences.english: A report that scores performance in terms of blue, green, amber and red.
sentences.chinese: 一份报告，以蓝，绿，黄以及红灯来为绩效打分。

sentences.english: That's the way we do it, no grading on a curve.
sentences.chinese: 我们就是这样做的，打分没有余地。

sentences.english: The teacher spent all weekend grading the children's papers.
sentences.chinese: 那位教师花了整个周末给孩子们的试卷打分数。

sentences.english: The scholarly literature concurs with the importance of consumer ratings.
sentences.chinese: 一些学术文献也认可消费者打分的重要性。

sentences.english: It receives an almost perfect 99 out of 100 on Rotten Tomatoes.
sentences.chinese: 在烂蕃茄网上的打分数是99%，几乎完美。

sentences.english: Zhou Lan glanced at the judges who were busy writing on their mark sheets.
sentences.chinese: 周兰瞥了一眼忙着在记分册上打分的裁判。

sentences.english: Use the following three-point rubric to evaluate students' work during this lesson.
sentences.chinese: 采用下面三分制量规对本课中学生的工作打分。

sentences.english: You must copy on paper , so you can grade yourself.
sentences.chinese: 你必须抄收在纸上，你可以自己打分。

sentences.english: One thing is never grade in red pen.
sentences.chinese: 第一件事是千万别用红笔打分。

definition: to grade/to mark (student's work)/grade/score (of student's work)
evaluation committee/judging panel/judging panel member/adjudicator/abbr. for 評選委員會委員|评选委员会委员[ping2 xuan3 wei3 yuan2 hui4 wei3 yuan2]
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
